result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:02 AM Defendant Tonya L. Burnett in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Tonya L. Burnett.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Halyburton and Burnett have complaint, filed a request for substitution. Court will accept as timely, continues bond, watch mail for new hearing date and notice of judge.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Tonya L. Burnett in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court asks defendant why she does not have counsel today. Burnett responds, too busy to find an attorney for stated reasons, asks Court to appoint Attorney Robert Kennedy. Court - first needs to find out if eligible for SPD and then court appointed counsel. Burnett states she wants to hire Attorney Kennedy, gives ramifications of returning again without talking to SPD or hiring an attorney, continues bond, sets for AIA on 9/21/22 at 10:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tonya L. (Malone) Burnett appeared by video, in custody, FC jail. Court questions if she has received a copy of her complaint. Burnett has not received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Burnett understands. Court questions if she has contacted an attorney. Burnett has contacted Attorney Kennedy, but needs time to get a retainer fee. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney, private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible. Burnett understands and will contact SPD to see if she is eligible. Court questions why she is incarcerated. Burnett is on PO hold. State asks for $1000 signature bond. Court imposes $1000 signature bond and has set for AIA to allow time to obtain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
